objectives: Students will engage in sophisticated discourse about populism and nationalism
Students will synthesize multiple viewpoints and construct nuanced arguments
Students will demonstrate mastery of register and stylistic flexibility
Students will use language precisely and effectively for academic/professional purposes
can_do_statements: Understand wide range of demanding, longer texts
Express ideas fluently and spontaneously without searching for expressions

warm_up.description: Students respond to a controversial statement about populism and nationalism
instructions: Small group discussion of different perspectives
Whole class synthesis of key arguments

discussion_questions: How would you characterize the discourse surrounding populism and nationalism?
What underlying assumptions shape our understanding of populism and nationalism?
To what extent is populism and nationalism a product of social construction?
How do power dynamics influence populism and nationalism?
What are the epistemological challenges in studying populism and nationalism?
How might interdisciplinary approaches enhance our grasp of populism and nationalism?
What are the implications of populism and nationalism for policy formulation?
How does populism and nationalism intersect with issues of equity and justice?
What paradigm shifts have occurred in thinking about populism and nationalism?
How can we reconcile competing frameworks for understanding populism and nationalism?
What are the long-term ramifications of current trends in populism and nationalism?
How does populism and nationalism challenge conventional wisdom?

teacher_notes.preparation: Review key vocabulary and concepts related to populism and nationalism
anticipated_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge on this topic
Students may need encouragement to speak at length
differentiation: Provide sentence starters for less confident students
Offer more complex discussion questions for advanced students
Allow use of dictionaries during preparation time
teacher_notes.cultural_considerations: Be aware of cultural sensitivities related to populism and nationalism
teacher_notes.follow_up: Monitor student progress and provide individual feedback
